Values.Name: NAOS_LOCAL
Values.Description: The local scope denotes messages that are transferred under the configured base topic of the device.

Values.Name: NAOS_GLOBAL
Values.Description: The global scope denotes messages that are transferred on a global level.

Values.Name: NAOS_CONNECTED
Values.Description: The device is connected to a WiFi access point.

Values.Name: NAOS_NETWORKED
Values.Description: The device is networked with a MQTT broker.

Functions.Name: naos_sync
Functions.Description: Will automatically apply parameter modifications and set the specified pointer to a buffer that contains the set value or an empty string if unset. It will read and set the currently stored value when invoked.
Functions.Note: This function should only be called from app_main() to ensure only one synchronization is registered per parameter.

Functions.Name: naos_sync_b
Functions.Description: Will automatically apply parameter modifications and set the specified pointer to the set value. It will read and set the currently stored value when invoked.
Functions.Note: This function should only be called from app_main() to ensure only one synchronization is registered per parameter.

Functions.Name: naos_sync_l
Functions.Description: Will automatically apply parameter modifications and set the specified pointer to the set value. It will read and set the currently stored value when invoked.
Functions.Note: This function should only be called from app_main() to ensure only one synchronization is registered per parameter.

Functions.Name: naos_sync_d
Functions.Description: Will automatically apply parameter modifications and set the specified pointer to the set value. It will read and set the currently stored value when invoked.
Functions.Note: This function should only be called from app_main() to ensure only one synchronization is registered per parameter.

Functions.Name: naos_millis
Functions.Description: Returns the elapsed milliseconds since the start.

Functions.Name: naos_delay
Functions.Description: Will delay current task for the specified amount of milliseconds.
Functions.Note: This function should only be used inside the loop callback.

Params.Name: ms
Params.Description: The amount of milliseconds to delay.

Fields.Name: ping_callback
Fields.Description: The callback that is called when a ping is received.

Fields.Name: online_callback
Fields.Description: The callback that is called once the device comes online.

Fields.Name: update_callback
Fields.Description: The callback that is called when a parameter has been updated. If the parameter was set, value is the string value. If the parameter was unset, value is NULL.

Fields.Args: )(const char *topic, uint8_t *payload, size_t len, naos_scope_t scope)
Fields.Name: message_callback
Fields.Description: The message callback is called with incoming messages.

Fields.Name: loop_callback
Fields.Description: The loop callback is called repeatedly if the device is online.

Fields.Name: loop_interval
Fields.Description: The interval of the loop callback in milliseconds.

Fields.Name: offline_callback
Fields.Description: The offline callback is called once the device becomes offline.

Fields.Name: status_callback
Fields.Description: The callback is called once the device has changed its status.

Fields.Name: battery_level
Fields.Description: This callback is called to retrieve battery information. It should be provided if the device has a battery power source.
Fields.Returns: A value between 0 and 1 indicating the battery charge level.

Fields.Name: delay_startup
Fields.Description: If set, the device will randomly (up to 5s) delay startup to overcome WiFi and MQTT congestion issues if many devices restart at the same time.

Fields.Name: name
Fields.Description: The name of the parameter e.g. "my-param".
